answerText: Nuclear Magnetic Resonance [accept more specific forms of NMR which reference hydrogen (proton NMR), carbon (13C NMR), or silicon (29Si NMR)][10] Typical solvents for proton NMR replace hydrogen with this atom, so that the solvent won't produce any peaks in the final spectrum.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 8 | 13 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Tetramethylsilane is defined to have a chemical shift of zero in this technique. [10] Name this technique which uses the splitting of spin-states of nuclei in a magnetic field to elucidate the structures of chemical compounds.
